TextLibrary.Text: Darkhunter
Lord Greythane
Syrus Darkhunter, did I not tell you to stay away from this place?
Syrus Darkhunter, did I not tell you to stay away from this place?
Syrus Darkhunter, did I not tell you to stay away from this place?
Syrus Darkhunter, did I not tell you to stay away from this place?
Unless I returned with your daughter, Liandra, yes you did, Sir.
Unless I returned with your daughter, Liandra, yes you did, Sir.
Unless I returned with your daughter, Liandra, yes you did, Sir.
Unless I returned with your daughter, Liandra, yes you did, Sir.
And yet you have returned without her once again. This time, I fear, you will not be leaving. Guards!
And yet you have returned without her once again. This time, I fear, you will not be leaving. Guards!
And yet you have returned without her once again. This time, I fear, you will not be leaving. Guards!
And yet you have returned without her once again. This time, I fear, you will not be leaving. Guards!
No! Wait! This time I have brought Liandra!
No! Wait! This time I have brought Liandra!
No! Wait! This time I have brought Liandra!
No! Wait! This time I have brought Liandra!
Then where is she?
Then where is she?
Then where is she?
Then where is she?

She is dead, Lord Greythane, we all knew that. But I have returned with her ashes that we might at least put this matter behind us. She was an Undead creature in thrall to Lord Bane. But I have freed her from that and returned her to you.

She is dead, Lord Greythane, we all knew that. But I have returned with her ashes that we might at least put this matter behind us. She was an Undead creature in thrall to Lord Bane. But I have freed her from that and returned her to you.

She is dead, Lord Greythane, we all knew that. But I have returned with her ashes that we might at least put this matter behind us. She was an Undead creature in thrall to Lord Bane. But I have freed her from that and returned her to you.

She is dead, Lord Greythane, we all knew that. But I have returned with her ashes that we might at least put this matter behind us. She was an Undead creature in thrall to Lord Bane. But I have freed her from that and returned her to you.
It is still your fault she is dead. What do you expect from me? Forgiveness?
It is still your fault she is dead. What do you expect from me? Forgiveness?
It is still your fault she is dead. What do you expect from me? Forgiveness?
It is still your fault she is dead. What do you expect from me? Forgiveness?
No, Sir, I would not expect that which I cannot even give myself. I merely wish to return Liandra to the place of her birth. After today, you will neither see me nor hear from me ever again.
No, Sir, I would not expect that which I cannot even give myself. I merely wish to return Liandra to the place of her birth. After today, you will neither see me nor hear from me ever again.
No, Sir, I would not expect that which I cannot even give myself. I merely wish to return Liandra to the place of her birth. After today, you will neither see me nor hear from me ever again.
No, Sir, I would not expect that which I cannot even give myself. I merely wish to return Liandra to the place of her birth. After today, you will neither see me nor hear from me ever again.
Then leave her ashes and go! And may there be a curse upon you for the rest of your miserable life for what you have done to my household.
Then leave her ashes and go! And may there be a curse upon you for the rest of your miserable life for what you have done to my household.
Then leave her ashes and go! And may there be a curse upon you for the rest of your miserable life for what you have done to my household.
Then leave her ashes and go! And may there be a curse upon you for the rest of your miserable life for what you have done to my household.
A curse there will be, Lord Greythane. Rest assured of that.
A curse there will be, Lord Greythane. Rest assured of that.
A curse there will be, Lord Greythane. Rest assured of that.
A curse there will be, Lord Greythane. Rest assured of that.
